Summary: Bright white circular object hovering stationary and twinkling below clouds.
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Warner Robins
There were no other sightings in Warner Robins on or around June 21st 2010
divs: Sighting Detailsmy six yr. old son and i went out to walk dog around 9:20. we went to our cul de sac and watched the stars because we've been seeing strange things in the sky lately (such as 4 wks. ago in broad daylight when he said ?look mommy, a rocket? and i looked up to see a dark gray object speeding overhead, an object that was definitely like a rocket, but had no wings, no tail and sped horizontally overhead until it passed over the trees). so we start walking out of the culdesac towards home and we noticed a very bright low light in the sky. i pointed it out to my son and urged him to hurry so we could pass the streetlight for a better look. it looked like the biggest lowest brightest closest star i had ever seen. it just sat there stationary and bright enough to shine through the tops of pine trees that we passed. upon reaching our driveway, i told my 6 yr. old to run in and get daddy fast. i continued watching and my 11 yr. old walked out. CANNOT COMPLETE DESCRIPTION PS3 WON'T LET ME TYPE MORE PLEASE EMAIL
